summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from August 10-11, 2019, regarding a time-sensitive question about Jeffrey Epstein from a prosecutor at the Southern District of New York. The chain shows coordination to contact the general counsel of an unspecified agency (likely the Bureau of Prisons) to request a delay, described as a courtesy to families, and to have defense counsel make direct contact.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the time-sensitive question from a prosecutor at the Southern District of New York. The email chain is about coordinating contact regarding him.

events.title: Prosecutor's time-sensitive inquiry about Epstein
events.description: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York sends an urgent email on a Saturday night seeking to discuss a time-sensitive question regarding Jeffrey Epstein, requesting a call.

keyFacts: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York was working on the Jeffrey Epstein case and made a time-sensitive inquiry on the evening of August 10, 2019.
The inquiry involved contacting the general counsel of an unspecified agency (redacted, likely BOP) to request a delay of 'a day or two', described as a courtesy generally offered to families.
The communication instructs that defense counsel should contact the general counsel directly.
The email chain shows coordination among multiple individuals (names redacted or partial) to facilitate this contact.

The document is dated August 11, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019 (note: date discrepancy; the email is timestamped August 10, 2019, and forwarded on August 11, 2019).
